data.description: Business Analytics Intern- 159 SolutionsHere, at IQVIA, we are building our internship program around smart, talented students that are excited about shaping the future of human health. As an IQVIA intern, you are able to create your own experience through insightful interaction with many different business units across the organization that will allow you to help us develop outside the box solutions to help solve some of the most important problems facing the healthcare industry. Every intern experience at IQVIA is unique and with our dedicated Early Talent Team here to take care of you, each intern will experience an inclusive intern community, fireside chats with executives, lunch & learns with various business units, access to our Employee Resource Groups, mentorship, skill shares, end of season presentations and much more!Join the IQVIA Intern Program today!If you have a passion for making a difference in healthcare, then consider joining the company that created the Human Data Science industry.Who are we?159 Solutions was founded in December 2013 to deliver a wide range of analytical solutions to life sciences clients. Sales and marketing teams are exposed to numerous data sets, but data is often complex to analyze and overwhelming. With a strong focus on delivering analytical projects rooted in market expertise, we felt the need to elevate consulting solutions beyond existing approaches via thoughtful partnerships. In order to achieve this, we ensure that the solutions delivered through our projects include time from senior staff, who are activity involved in solving the business question. This role is an ideal stepping-stone to current college students. This position will provide exposure to various components of 159 Solutions and Emerging Biotech within IQVIA.Essential FunctionsUnder close supervision, assists in the following:Integrate multiple healthcare data sets to support insights generationPerform quantitative analysis to understand & validate data, spot patterns and trends, and generate takeaways and recommendations to client business needsDesign presentations and visuals to communicate key results of analysisPartner with clients to identify key business questions and shape impactful and actionable solutionsCollaborate effectively with 159 onshore and offshore teamsContribute to team discussions during brainstorming, planning, and problem-solving sessionsProactively develops a basic knowledge of consulting methodologies and the life sciences market through the delivery of consulting engagements and participation in formal and informal learning opportunitiesQualificationsPursuing a Bachelor’s or Advanced Degree in a relevant field such as Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Biostatistics, Economics, or BusinessStrong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex analysis into strategic insights and recommendations for sales and marketing teamsKeen interest in the biotechnology, healthcare, and pharmaceutical industry coupled with willingness to learn about product marketing, sales analytics, and business intelligenceExcellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to interact effectively with teammates and clientsEmphasis on attention to detail and quality of workStrong collaborator and team playerEffective planning and time management skillsIQVIA is a leading global provider of clinical research services, commercial insights and healthcare intelligence to the life sciences and healthcare industries. We create intelligent connections to accelerate the development and commercialization of innovative medical treatments to help improve patient outcomes and population health worldwide. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.comIQVIA is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other status protected by applicable law. https://jobs.iqvia.com/eoeThe potential base pay range for this role, when annualized, is $26,500.00 - $66,100.00. The actual base pay offered may vary based on a number of factors including job-related qualifications such as knowledge, skills, education, and experience; location; and/or schedule (full or part-time). Dependent on the position offered, incentive plans, bonuses, and/or other forms of compensation may be offered, in addition to a range of health and welfare and/or other benefits.
requirements: Pursuing a Bachelor’s or Advanced Degree in a relevant field such as Engineering, Computer Science, Math, Statistics, Biostatistics, Economics, or Business
responsibilities: Collaborate effectively with 159 onshore and offshore teams

Proactively develops a basic knowledge of consulting methodologies and the life sciences market through the delivery of consulting engagements and participation in formal and informal learning opportunities
Keen interest in the biotechnology, healthcare, and pharmaceutical industry coupled with willingness to learn about product marketing, sales analytics, and business intelligence
